comments.body: The object needs to extend ng.IScope
Interesting.  I guess I made a poor assumption here
Can you comment on this?

You can pass in the string value of scope.

For example:

```
$scope.searchResults = []

 $scope.gridOptions = {
data: 'searchResults'
}
```
Ahh.  I wasn't familiar with that.  Is it documented?
This should be uiGridConstants.ASC or uiGridConstants.DESC which are both numbers

@btesser  -- UiGridConstants.ASC returns a string as far as i can tell:

https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-grid/blob/master/src/js/core/constants.js#L65
Wow I guess I overlooked that... my bad
This one is correct.

I was able to find `useExternalFiltering` in the ui-grid API documentation (http://ui-grid.info/docs/#/api/ui.grid.class:GridOptions), but I couldn't find `enableGridMenu` documented anywhere.  I assume it does exist as I found it referred to in the source (https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-grid/blob/e8e5653/src/features/exporter/js/exporter.js#L1221), but just curious how you came about the documentation for that option.  Is this a case where it would be good to update and improve the ui-grid documentation as well?

@joeskeen The enableGridMenu option is part of their tutorial 

http://ui-grid.info/docs/#/tutorial/121_grid_menu
@joeskeen Thanks for the review! I'll update the API docs and will submit a PR soon.

I tested this, and it does seem to work at runtime, but I can't find any reference to this in the documentation (http://ui-grid.info/docs/#/api/ui.grid.class:Grid).  Perhaps this would be a good opportunity to improve the docs?
@joeskeen It is part of their tutorial (http://ui-grid.info/docs/#/tutorial/308_external_filtering) but I agree that the API documentation can be improved. I'll be submitting a pull request soon.

Fair enough!  @vvakame , ready to merge! :+1: 

@ashwin027 thanks for your contribution!
@joeskeen Thanks for the review!
missing space after *

I'd also remove (optional) since that is already indicated by the `?`
to add in the specific types you do:

```
sortDirectionCycle?: Array<IUiGridConstants.ASC | IUiGridConstants.DESC>
```
I agree with @btesser-r7 @btesser, these things should be fixed.

I don't think `sortDirectionCycle?: Array<IUiGridConstants>` is right, as it should be an array including `uiGridConstants.ASC`, `uiGridConstants.DESC` and/or `null`, while `IUiGridConstants` is the interface that contains these constants, not the constants themselves. When I try and use sortDirectionCycle, I get:

```
  Types of property 'sortDirectionCycle' are incompatible.
    Type 'string[]' is not assignable to type 'IUiGridConstants[]'.
      Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'IUiGridConstants'.
```
This hunk looks good :)

Sorry for the confusion. Actually, this PR was for the `refresh` method, but I didn't know enough about Git and pushed this commit ([ab12eb7](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/8947/commits/ab12eb7927be2b54ccb8e8caa037a57967118441)) to the same branch.
Should I revert/drop this commit or will it be merged along with the other ([9346a92](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/8947/commits/9346a921e033dc4e30c2a81a6e2451f7811cc8c5))?
I'm fine leaving it here, unless @btesser-r7 objects.
lgtm

I'm not seeing any reference to the `rowsAltered` parameter in the documentation.  This is what I see:

> `refresh()`
> 
> Refresh the rendered grid on screen. The refresh method re-runs both the columnProcessors and the rowProcessors, as well as calling refreshCanvas to update all the grid sizing. In general you should prefer to use queueGridRefresh instead, which is basically a debounced version of refresh.
> 
> If you only want to resize the grid, not regenerate all the rows and columns, you should consider directly calling refreshCanvas instead.
> (see http://ui-grid.info/docs/#/api/ui.grid.core.api:PublicApi)

I did find this parameter in the code at https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-grid/blob/68681d7/src/js/core/factories/Grid.js#L2039, but we try to keep the type definitions to documented parameters.  Would you mind submitting a change to the documentation by editing the file here: https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-grid/edit/master/src/js/core/factories/Grid.js.  You can then submit a pull request to https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-grid/ and reference this pull request.  Once the documentation has this parameter, I would happily approve this PR.
rowA and rowB is not optional parameters?

I don't think they should be optional.

If they were optional then ui-grid would be able to not provide values for them when calling the callback, and the documentation doesn't say anything about that.

Note that the function you assign to `sortingAlgorithm` does not need to declare all parameters - it could just declare `a` and `b` and ignore the others.
